codeSystems.name: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.title: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: BundleType
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.name: Use
codeSystems.title: Use
codeSystems.description: The purpose of the Claim: predetermination, preauthorization, claim.

codeSystems.name: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.title: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.description: The days of the week.

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: LinkType
codeSystems.title: LinkType
codeSystems.description: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
codeSystems.title: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
codeSystems.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

codeSystems.name: RequestIntent
codeSystems.title: RequestIntent
codeSystems.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a request.

codeSystems.name: RequestPriority
codeSystems.title: RequestPriority
codeSystems.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: TaskIntent
codeSystems.title: TaskIntent
codeSystems.description: Distinguishes whether the task is a proposal, plan or full order.

codeSystems.name: TaskStatus
codeSystems.title: TaskStatus
codeSystems.description: The current status of the task.

codeSystems.name: CDexTempCodes
codeSystems.title: CDex Temporary Code System
codeSystems.description: Codes temporarily defined as part of the CDex implementation guide.  These will eventually migrate into an officially maintained terminology (likely HL7's [UTG](https://terminology.hl7.org/codesystems.html) code systems).
codeSystems.ValueSet-cdex-data-request-task-code.htm: CDex Data Request Task Code Value Set
codeSystems.ValueSet-cdex-POU.html: CDex Purpose of Use Value Set

codeSystems.name: PASTempCodes
codeSystems.title: PAS Temporary Codes
codeSystems.description: Codes temporarily defined as part of the PAS implementation guide.  These will eventually migrate into an officially maintained terminology (likely either SNOMED CT or HL7's UTG code systems).

codeSystems.name: LOINC
codeSystems.title: Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC)
codeSystems.description: LOINC provides a set of universal names and ID codes for identifying laboratory and clinical test results.1,2 LOINC facilitates the exchange and pooling of results, such as blood hemoglobin, serum potassium, or vital signs, for clinical care, outcomes management, and research. LOINC's universal identifiers (names and codes) can be used in the context of order and observation exchanges between information systems that use syntax standards such as HL73, CEN TC251, ISO TC215, ASTM4, and DICOM. Specifically, the identifier can be used as the coded value for an observation in any other standard that uses the observation/observation value paradigm, whether messages, documents, application programming interface (API), etc. For example, LOINC codes are used widely in the OBX segment Observation Identifier field (OBX-3) of an ORU HL7 (HL7 version 2.x or ASTM 1238-9410) message that may be sent between a Clinical Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) and Electronic Health Record Systems (EHR).5, 6 In this way, LOINC codes provide universal identifiers that allow the exchange of clinical data between heterogeneous computing environments.
codeSystems.ValueSet-cdex-loinc-attachment-codes.htm: CDex LOINC Attachment Codes Value Set

codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).

codeSystems.name: CommonTags
codeSystems.title: Common Tags
codeSystems.description: Common Tag Codes defined by FHIR project

codeSystems.name: PractitionerRole
codeSystems.title: Practitioner role
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the role of a Practitioner.

codeSystems.name: ContactRole2
codeSystems.title: contactRole2
codeSystems.description: Code system of concepts which specify a relationship role that the next of kin/associated parties plays with regard to the patient. Also used in referrals, for example, it may be necessary to identify the contact representative at the clinic that sent a referral. Used in HL7 Version 2 messaging in the NK1 and CTD segments after 2.5, when it replace 2.16.840.1.113883.18.57.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierType
codeSystems.title: identifierType
codeSystems.description: HL7-defined code system of concepts specifying type of identifier. Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging data types CX, PLN, PPN, XCN and XON.

codeSystems.name: ActReason
codeSystems.title: ActReason
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an Act, when such rationale is not reasonably represented as an ActRelationship of type "has reason" linking to another Act.

*Examples:* Example reasons that might qualify for being coded in this field might be: "routine requirement", "infectious disease reporting requirement", "on patient request", "required by law".
codeSystems.ValueSet-cdex-POU.html: CDex Purpose of Use Value Set

codeSystems.title: MaritalStatus
codeSystems.description:
\* \* \* No description supplied \* \* \*

*Open Issue:* The specific meanings of these codes can vary somewhat by jurisdiction and implementation so caution should be used when determining equivalency.

codeSystems.name: NullFlavor
codeSystems.title: NullFlavor
codeSystems.description: A collection of codes specifying why a valid value is not present.

codeSystems.name: Ietf3066
codeSystems.title: Tags for the Identification of Languages
codeSystems.description: Older value from OID registry.  Superceded; see recommendations in BCP-47.

codeSystems.name: SignatureTypeCodes
codeSystems.title: Signature Type Codes
codeSystems.description: The Digital Signature Purposes, an indication of the reason an entity signs a document. This is included in the signed information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document. Examples include: author, transcriptionist/recorder, and witness.
